cookieConsent.title: Cookie Information
cookieConsent.message: This app uses only essential cookies and local storage to manage authentication, sessions, and learning progress. These functions are necessary for the app to operate correctly and do not require user consent under GDPR or Thailand's PDPA. No tracking or advertising cookies are used.
cookieConsent.updatedMessage: Our privacy policy and terms of service have been updated. Please review the changes.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content1: TutorCat is an AI-powered language learning platform developed by Mathayomwatsing School to provide interactive English language education for students. This platform combines gamified learning with AI-driven feedback to create an engaging and effective learning experience.
introduction.content2: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect personal information when you use TutorCat. By using our platform, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.
introduction.dataController: Data Controller: Aleksandr Petrov, Mathayomwatsing School

userConsent.title: User Consent
userConsent.content: By using TutorCat, users (or their parents/guardians if under 18) consent to the collection, processing, and use of their personal data as described in this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with this policy, please do not use our platform.

features.1: Receive AI-powered feedback on speaking and writing
features.3: Take placement tests to determine language level

childrensPrivacy.title: Children's Privacy
childrensPrivacy.content: TutorCat is designed specifically for students and educational use. We are committed to protecting the privacy of children under 18 years of age.
childrensPrivacy.parentalRights: Parental Rights: Parents and guardians have the right to review, modify, or request deletion of their child's personal information. Please contact the school administration at aleksandr.p@mws.ac.th for any privacy-related requests regarding student data.

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.intro: We collect only the minimum data necessary to provide educational services:

accountInfo.title: Account Information
accountInfo.content: Student name, email, grade level, and class information for authentication and personalization.

learningData.title: Learning Data
learningData.content: Answers, scores, progress, completion status, and time spent on activities.

technicalData.title: Technical Data
technicalData.content: Device information, browser type, and usage patterns to improve platform performance.

dataCollection.important: Important: TutorCat does not collect sensitive personal information beyond what is necessary for educational purposes. We do not sell, share, or use student data for advertising or commercial purposes.

dataUsage.title: How We Use Your Data
dataUsage.intro: Student data is used exclusively for educational purposes:

purposes.1: Track academic progress and learning achievements
purposes.2: Generate AI-powered feedback for language exercises
purposes.3: Improve platform functionality and user experience
purposes.5: Generate reports for teachers and parents

dataStorage.title: Data Storage & Security
dataStorage.content1: Student data is stored securely using industry-standard encryption and security measures. All data is hosted on secure cloud infrastructure compliant with educational data protection standards.
dataStorage.content2: We implement technical and organizational security measures to prevent unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction of personal information.

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing and Disclosure
dataSharing.intro: We do not sell, rent, or trade student data. Data may only be shared in the following circumstances:
circumstances: Teachers and School Staff: For educational assessment and progress monitoring
Parents/Guardians: To review their child's learning progress and achievements
Legal Requirements: When required by law or educational regulations
Service Providers: With trusted educational technology providers under strict contracts

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.intro: Students, parents, and guardians have the following rights regarding personal data:

rights.0: Access and review personal data collected
rights.3: Object to certain data processing activities

userRights.contact: Contact: To exercise these rights, please contact Aleksandr Petrov at

cookies.title: Cookies and Local Storage
cookies.intro: TutorCat uses essential cookies and local storage to provide core functionality and maintain a secure learning environment.

authCookies.title: Authentication Cookies
authCookies.content: Secure HTTP-only cookies store authentication tokens to keep students logged in safely.

progressStorage.title: Progress Storage
progressStorage.content: Local storage saves learning progress and answers to prevent data loss during sessions.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We retain student data only as long as necessary to provide educational services and comply with school record-keeping requirements. Academic records may be retained according to educational data retention policies. Students or parents may request data deletion at any time.

policyChanges.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
policyChanges.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify users of any material changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date. Continued use of TutorCat after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content1: By accessing and using TutorCat, an AI-powered language learning platform developed by Mathayomwatsing School, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement.
acceptance.content2: If you do not agree to abide by the above, please do not use this service. This Terms of Service agreement is effective as of

serviceDescription.title: Description of Service
serviceDescription.intro: TutorCat is an educational platform that provides:

features.1: AI-powered feedback on speaking and writing exercises
features.3: Placement testing to determine language proficiency levels
features.4: Educational content and resources for language learning

serviceDescription.educationalUse: The platform is designed specifically for educational use by students of Mathayomwatsing School.

userAccounts.title: User Accounts
userAccounts.intro: To access certain features of TutorCat, you must create an account. You are responsible for:

responsibilities.0: Maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials
responsibilities.1: All activities that occur under your account
responsibilities.2: Notifying school administration immediately of any unauthorized use

userAccounts.studentResponsibility: Student Responsibility: Students are responsible for appropriate use of the platform. Misuse may result in account suspension or other disciplinary actions.

acceptableUse.title: Acceptable Use Policy
acceptableUse.intro: By using TutorCat, you agree to use the platform appropriately and in compliance with school policies:

prohibitedActivities.3: Using the platform for non-educational purposes
prohibitedActivities.4: Attempting to access other users' data

academicIntegrity.title: Academic Integrity
academicIntegrity.content1: TutorCat includes measures to ensure fair assessment and maintain academic integrity. By using this platform, you agree to maintain honest academic practices.
academicIntegrity.content2: The platform may monitor user behavior during assessments and exercises. Any attempts to cheat, plagiarize, or otherwise violate academic integrity may result in:

consequences.3: Other disciplinary actions as determined by school policy

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content1: TutorCat and its original content, features, and functionality are owned by Mathayomwatsing School and are protected by copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws.
intellectualProperty.content2: User-generated content submitted to the platform remains the property of the user, but by submitting content, users grant the school a license to use, display, and distribute the content for educational purposes.

privacyDataProtection.title: Privacy and Data Protection
privacyDataProtection.content1: Your privacy is important to us. Please review our
privacyDataProtection.content2: which explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.
privacyDataProtection.content3: By using TutorCat, you consent to the collection and use of your data as described in our Privacy Policy.

serviceAvailability.title: Service Availability
serviceAvailability.content1: While we strive to provide continuous access to TutorCat, we do not guarantee that the service will be available at all times. The platform may be unavailable due to:
serviceAvailability.content2: We will make reasonable efforts to minimize service disruptions and notify users in advance when possible.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: TutorCat is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. Mathayomwatsing School shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages arising from the use of the platform. Our total liability shall not exceed the amount paid by the user for the service, if any.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content1: We reserve the right to terminate or suspend your account and access to TutorCat at our discretion, without prior notice, for conduct that violates these Terms of Service or school policies.
termination.content2: Upon termination, your right to use the service will cease immediately. All provisions of these Terms that by their nature should survive termination shall survive, including ownership provisions, warranty disclaimers, and limitations of liability.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms of Service shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Thailand, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any disputes arising from these terms shall be resolved through the appropriate school administration channels.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. We will notify users of material changes by posting the updated terms on this page and updating the "Last updated" date. Continued use of TutorCat after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.

footer.description: An innovative AI-powered language learning platform designed for students at Mathayomwatsing School, combining gamified learning with intelligent feedback to make language acquisition engaging and effective.
footer.educationalNote: TutorCat is an educational platform developed by Mathayomwatsing School to enhance language learning through AI-powered feedback and gamified experiences. For educational use only.

meetTeam.title: Meet the Team
meetTeam.subtitle: The talented individuals behind TutorCat, dedicated to creating an innovative language learning experience
meetTeam.footerNote: TutorCat is developed by Mathayomwatsing School for educational purposes.

descriptions.mattcha: Passionate about creating beautiful and interactive user interfaces. Loves coding because it allows bringing creative ideas to life through React and Next.js. Built the lesson flow, activity components, and dashboard UI using TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Framer Motion animations. Implemented drag-and-drop interactions with Konva.js and integrated Lottie animations for an engaging learning experience.
descriptions.jaroenjit: Loves coding because it combines creativity with technical skills to create meaningful user experiences. Designed the entire UI/UX of TutorCat, including the landing page, lesson interface, and admin panel. Created responsive layouts using Tailwind CSS, designed the color scheme and typography, and ensured accessibility across all devices. Focused on making the platform intuitive and visually appealing for language learners.
descriptions.nichapath: Passionate about ensuring quality and reliability in software. Loves coding because it teaches attention to detail and systematic thinking. Tested all features including lesson activities, authentication flows, and database operations. Verified cross-browser compatibility, mobile responsiveness, and API endpoint functionality. Created test cases for grammar exercises, vocabulary matching, speaking activities, and achievement system to ensure a bug-free learning experience.
descriptions.aleksandr: Lead educator and platform curator with extensive experience in language teaching and educational technology. Oversees curriculum development and ensures the platform meets educational standards. Coordinates the development team and provides guidance on pedagogical features.
